title.narrative: EMERGENCY Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: By 2020, government has increased capacity to lead and coordinate Humanitarian Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) partnerships to meet the needs of the impacted populations, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Disaster Risk Reduction, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Wash And Emergencies, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, people in targeted rural, small towns, and peri-urban areas use sustainable and safe drinking water services, adequate sanitation and improved hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, government has increased capacity to lead and coordinate Humanitarian WASH partnerships to meet the needs of the impacted populations

description.narrative: In 2019, Mozambique experienced a L3 emergency after two cyclones struck the country in succession. UNICEF led the Cluster in coordinating the WASH response for the 2.75 million people impacted (530K for ongoing drought, 1.85M for Cyclone Idai, and 374K for Cyclone Kenneth). The WASH Cluster targeted 2,160,000 individuals and reached this target with overall assistance to 2,181,000 individuals. UNICEF programs directly assisted 1,341,000 individuals with access to safe water (62% cluster target) and 184,500 individuals with access to sanitation (38% cluster target) in addition to indirect beneficiaries receiving WASH cluster supplies and coordination support from UNICEF. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2020

title.narrative: People in humanitarian situations who access safe drinking water as per agreed sector/cluster coordination standards and norms

baseline.value: Operational however with limited Government leadership

target.value: 2020:WASH Cluster/sector operational and co-chaired by DNAAS and UNICEF

actual.value: 2019:Operational cluster co-chaired by DNAAS and UNICEF (decentralized to DPOPHRH)

title.narrative: National WASH emergency response standards exist and are met in emergency response situations
